intro: Oligocarpus calendulaceus, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its bulbs are toxic and contain compounds similar to those found in other members of the Amaryllidaceae family. Oligocarpus calendulaceus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
